thread.section_title: Business & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Obama’s Cable Monopoly Boom

author: Holman W. Jenkins, Jr.
title: Obama’s Cable Monopoly Boom
text:
No industry, except maybe health insurers, has benefited so much from Obama policy as cable companies. Their stocks have been pretty much straight up since the president introduced his net-neut utility regulation policy in November.
Overwhelmingly, the signal from the markets is that cable’s dominance of fast broadband is less under threat today than it was the day before the Federal Communications Commission supinely aligned itself... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
